extensionDescription.message: Save content from the web in a private and durable format that you can access offline. The official browser extension for Obsidian.

onlyHttpSupported.message: This page cannot be clipped. Only http and https URLs are supported.

noTemplates.message: No templates available. Please add a template in the settings.

languageDescription.message: Choose the display language for the extension interface.

vaultsDescription.message: By default, clipped notes are saved to the currently open vault. You can add vaults here if you want the option to save to different vaults. Vault names must exactly match the name of the Obsidian vault. Press $strong_start$enter$strong_end$ to add a vault.

addVaultPlaceholder.message: Press enter to add a vault

showActionsDescription.message: Allows you to inspect page variables from the clipper menu. Useful for seeing the variables that are available to use in templates.

earlyAccessDescription.message: Use features that require the latest $link_start$early access version$link_end$ of Obsidian. Currently requires Obsidian 1.7.2 or later.

silentOpen.message: Save clipped note without opening it

silentOpenDescription.message: Clipped notes will be saved but will not open as a new tab. Obsidian will still be brought to the foreground.

legacyModeDescription.message: Uses the URI clipping method compatible with Obsidian 1.6.7 or earlier. Note that the length of the content you can clip is limited by your browser and OS. Some pages may fail without any errors.

resetDefaultTemplateDescription.message: Remove any changes you've made to the default template.

exportAllSettingsDescription.message: Export all settings including templates and properties.

importAllSettingsDescription.message: Import all settings including templates and properties. This will replace your current configuration.

importPropertiesDescription.message: To import your properties from Obsidian, locate the $strong_1_start$types.json$strong_1_end$ file in the $strong_2_start$.obsidian$strong_2_end$ folder within your vault. Note this folder is hidden by default on most operating systems.

exportPropertiesDescription.message: Save Web Clipper properties to a $strong_start$types.json$strong_end$ file that can be imported into your Obsidian vault, or into Web Clipper on other devices.

removeUnusedPropertiesDescription.message: Remove all properties that are not used in any template.

enableHighlighterDescription.message: Highlight content on web pages that you can save to Obsidian.

exportHighlightsDescription.message: Export your highlights to a file.

alwaysShowHighlightsDescription.message: Display your saved highlights when you load a page. Turn off to only display highlights when highlighter mode is activated.

clipBehaviorDescription.message: Choose how highlighted content is saved to Obsidian. Defines the $strong_start${{content}}$strong_end$ variable.

appendToExisting.message: Add to an existing note, at the bottom

prependToExisting.message: Add to an existing note, at the top

appendToDaily.message: Add to daily note, at the bottom

prependToDaily.message: Add to daily note, at the top

behaviorWarning.message: Adding to an existing note or daily note requires Obsidian 1.7.2 or later.

noteNameFormatDescription.message: Format for the file name of the note. You can use variables like {{title}}, {{date}}, and {{published}} to pre-populate data from the page. $link_start$Learn more$link_end$.

noteLocationDescription.message: The folder or path of the note.

vaultDescription.message: Select the default vault for this template. Go to $link_start$general settings$link_end$ to add or remove vaults.

templateTriggersDescription.message: Define rules to automatically select this template if it matches a URL pattern or contains schema.org data. One rule per line.

templatePropertiesDescription.message: Properties to add to the top of the clipped note. Use variables to pre-populate data from the page.

noteContentDescription.message: Customize the content of the note. Use variables to pre-populate data from the page.

interpreterContextDescription.message: The context used to interpret prompt variables. Overrides the default context defined in $link_start$Interpreter settings$link_end$. Variables can be used here.

shortcutInstructionsIntro.message: Keyboard shortcuts give you quick access to clipper features.

shortcutInstructionsChrome.message: To change key assignments, go to $1

shortcutInstructionsBrave.message: To change key assignments, go to $1

shortcutInstructionsFirefox.message: To change key assignments, go to $1, click the gear icon, and select "Manage Extension Shortcuts".

shortcutInstructionsEdge.message: To change key assignments, go to $1

shortcutInstructionsSafari.message: Keyboard shortcuts are not available for Safari extensions.

shortcutInstructionsDefault.message: To change key assignments, please refer to your browser's extension settings.

failedToResetTemplate.message: Failed to reset default template. Please try again.

failedToProcessInterpreter.message: Interpreter processing failed. Please try again.

confirmDeleteTemplate.message: Are you sure you want to delete the template "$1"?

failedToDeleteTemplate.message: Failed to delete template. Please try again.
